svg.font-family: SauceCodePro Nerd Font, Source Code Pro, Courier

g.text: File entry glob to process for beginning
`file` files will be treated by default as
globs. Set this to `true` to disable. Defaults
Require path to be passed intermediate AST.
Passed "enter" or "exit" and an object with
run once for each module type, whether "esm",
resolved imports for that file). Default is
Whether to iterate serially and ensure
consistent order in visiting files. Default is
If assuming a Node.js environment (or one
otherwise using the Node resolution algorithm).
Will not be used on html files. Defaults to
When using `node`, one can override default of
`browser`, etc. also. The first values added
If assuming a TypeScript environment (or one
algorithm). Will not be used on html files.
If set will not perform the normal checks for
non-HTML JavaScript files of the `type` in the
Defaults to `undefined`, but is overridden by
Whether ES Modules imports should not be
followed (and whether mjs files should not be
treat ".cjs" files as CommonJS). Defaults to
Whether to check AMD modules. Note that this
Whether to force treatment of files as a file
Extension(s) to be treated as (static) HTML.
Extension(s) to be treated as JavaScript.
Regular expression to match paths to exclude
from including or visiting. By default, this
blacklist will not be in effect. Set, for
example to `".css"` to avoid entering your
source files. If no slashes are used (for
flags), will default to using the `u` flag
Regular expression to match paths to include.
By default, this whitelist will not be in
to restrict results to dependencies. If no
slashes are used (for flags), will default to
Regular expression to match paths to exclude.
By default, this blacklist will not be in
effect. Set, for example to `"/src/"` to avoid
including your source files. If no slashes are
used (for flags), will default to using the `u`
Indicates the parser to use. Unless using
be sure the parser is added to your
to pass to the parser (`babel-eslint` is the
one built-in by default). Defaults to an object
passed in and `sourceType` set to "module" by
default if the file extension ends in "mjs" or
to "script" if it ends in "cjs" (you can
manually set this as desired to force the type
when the type is not set by the HTML script
type). Note that passing in HTML files will
cause `sourceType` to be auto-set depending on
whether it is specified as a script or module.
File path to which to save output (as JSON).
Format to log to console. "strings" may be
piped into ESLint. "none" may be desired when
`output` is used. Defaults to "strings" in CLI
Opt in to include non-JS types in results
(built-in Node modules or JSON). Default is not
to use (only JS files are included as needed
when passing to ESLint without such as a JSON
If a file cannot be found (e.g., because it is
